TEXT.TITLE: U.S. M-1 MONEY SUPPLY FALLS 600 MLN DLRS
TEXT.BODY: U.S. M-1 money supply fell 600 mln dlrs to a seasonally adjusted 738.0 billion dlrs in the March 2 week, the Federal Reserve said. The previous week's M-1 level was revised to 738.6 billion dlrs from 738.5 billion, while the four-week moving average of M-1 rose to 737.1 billion dlrs from 736.8 billion. Commenting on February growth of the broader monetary aggregates, the Fed said that M-2 fell 1.6 billion dlrs, while M-3 rose three billion. Economists polled by Reuters had projected a 900 mln dlr fall in M-1, a 1.8 billion dlr drop in M-2 and no change in M-3. Reuter
